website_summaries.verdict: Featuring top-notch call quality and loaded with features, the Anker Soundcore Liberty Air 2 is an excellent value alternative to the AirPods Pro.
pros: The affordable Anker Soundcore Liberty Air 2 improve on their predecessor in several ways, including top-notch performance for making calls, boosted battery life, USB-C and wireless charging and nicer matte finish on the buds and compact charging case
They're water-resistant and should fit most ears well
Sound can be tweaked in the companion app and you can program touch controls to include volume up/down

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Was going to buy AirPods but my daughter had a pair of these and loved them. They’re great! Stay in my ears without slipping at all, even on my run. Sound amazing with good noise reduction (I don’t like canceling anyway). Very happy with these!
customer_reviews.author: Shannan Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like these but the sound quality was too tinny like the mids and highs were blasted...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these because they are nice and light, have a small light case and good touch controls. All this with USB-C and at a great price. However I am not sure if mine were defective, need a firmware upgrade, stuck in headset/call mode or are just not tuned correctly out of the factory but they sounded really bad. It sounded like the mids and highs were cranked up way too high. I tried using the app to change EQ settings but nothing helped. Back they go I guess. The Liberty 2's are still my favorite model and what I am sticking with for now.
customer_reviews.author: xMishka

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound and great fit!
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying these wireless earbuds and they are my first device pair ever, they connected right away to my S9 and sound great! I recommend downloading the Soundcore app and trying different EQ settings to your taste, there are plenty to choose from. Battery life is really good as well. The price is a little on the premium side, with that said they are extremely nice build quality. The wireless charging on the case is a neat feature.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Zero Star Waste of time and $$
customer_reviews.text: What is the most basic function of headphones, assuming you have two working ears? It is to be able to hear sound out of BOTH sides at the SAME time. This product fails this most basic test. Right ear don't pair with left or vice versa. The fact that there are known problems should have been a factor in the CNET reviews that steered me to this crappy product. I know there are videos to try and fix the pairing issue. My point is that this shouldn't be an issue. Would you wear glasses where you could on see out of one eye at a time? They should get the basics right and then focus on extras
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: No. Just no. Read everyone else’s review about pairing issues. We tried 2 iPhones and 1 droid. Only right ear would pair. I’ve never had so much trouble pairing a Bluetooth item before. Way too much time spent and no solution. This was a waste of time and money. I wouldn’t keep them if they were free.
customer_reviews.author: BestAmazonReviews

customer_reviews.title: Connections Issues are real
customer_reviews.text: so I bought them after reading good reviews of sound and look and feel. They look nice ! feel good! sound well there is the issue I could never pair both of the ear buds only one connected I reset many times looked for help online and I ever email sound core they sent instructions that I had all ready found online and did not solve issue. For the price you think they should pair easy and in all honestly shouldn't even have that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Very portable and great value for your money!
customer_reviews.text: Great alternative to the airpods BUT at 1/3 of its price. The built quality and finish is impressive at this price. Microphone noise isolation is quite good. I had no complaints while making IP calls in noisy environments.
customer_reviews.author: JOYE

customer_reviews.title: Soundcore 1 : Airpods 0
customer_reviews.text: More battery life and equal sound quality to airpods without the hefty price tag. If only they would add a little through vent to get rid of pressure in the ear, these would be the absolute best. It's not a deal breaker, but would be guaranteed win over airpods if it did have the vent. They may look larger than airpods in the picture, but no noticable bulkiness in ear when compared to airpods. Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Of no use
customer_reviews.text: Earbuds are fragile and tear easily. None of the provided earbuds kept them firmly in my ears. Sensor that turns the sound off when the bud is removed only works on the right side. They are heavy, and it took very little effort to dislodge them from my ears. I wanted to like these. Very disappointed. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware, unstable pairing and sync issues.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product experience. Minimal documentation in the box. Right earbud would pair but not left. Reseated them both in the case, disabled Bluetooth and reset both per instructions on Anker website. They paired but they would not connect to the soundcore app. This is critical for firmware updates and eq settings. Disabled Bluetooth and went through the reset process again. After 10 tries the left earbud will still not pair. Seems to be a very common experience and I have no patience for a product that's this finicky with a solution that amounts to a reboot as the fix. I'll be looking elsewhere for tws earbuds. Very disappointed with Anker.
customer_reviews.author: al.outside

customer_reviews.title: Good earbuds, great service after the sale
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a set of ear buds with long battery life and good frequency response. These looked to be a good choice. I charged the phones and linked to my phone. So far so good. I installed the companion application and ran the setup process. All this was quick, easy and error free. I had some issues with the sound profile, so I contacted Anker. They worked tirelessly to solve my problem and ensure I had a great set of earbuds. Kudos to Anker plain and simple! These earbuds are costly, and if they don’t sound great the company making them should work with you to make it right. Anker does this!
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY amazing
customer_reviews.text: I just got these and they are absolutely amazing so far. I had a little issue with pairing them but that was my mistake. The sound quality is exceptional. I work in a factory and they stay in all night and are very comfortable. The only thing I have noticed is that they DO NOT have a volume control. That is done by your phone/ipod or whatever. however, they still sound amazing. I would definitely recommend them to anyone Update: I downloaded the soundcore app and you can change the way you push/hold the earbuds. I changed mine to volume control and it works better now that I can control the volume. These are still awesome. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Italiano810

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I've tried so many different ear buds, I've lost count. These fit snugly inside the ear, the sound is good on both music and phone calls (usually it's one or the other with most brands). They aren't as good a quality as my Bose, of course, but excellent for the normal day-to-day routine. The battery lasts waaaaaay longer than I'd expected. The bluetooth syncs beautifully with my iphone or my pc, although I wish it were a little more intuitive and a little less manual to switch between the two. And I love having a more subtle option to those weird white sticks that which are distracting to me. I'm so grateful to be out of the buy/return endless loop!
customer_reviews.author: trendsmart

customer_reviews.title: Decent for $
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. The design seals off the ear, so while talking with them you hear yourself talking and it throws me off. I wouldn’t purchase for working out or if you plan on using them to talk on the phone a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: I love these!!!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say but WOW! The sound is great and works well with any genre of music you listen to. The battery life really makes these worth it if you're a commuter. Not only that the mic quality of these is right on the heels of the performance of airpods. Great value for my dollar for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Derrick B.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality of mic and sound kept flipping between ears
customer_reviews.text: I already returned these. First time using the mic people said I sounded static/robotic. The second time using the sound kept hoping from one ear to the other and sound quality went way down with a lot of static on both the mic and hearing. Had to stop using as it gave me a headache with how much the sound kept switching up. I don’t know much about the battery since I only used them twice. Noise cancelation seemed decent both times but again I did not use them enough to really test enough.
customer_reviews.author: STL aunt caker

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expect out of a $100 Bluetooth Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Sound Quality is close to the airpods - Ear comfort is good if you use the right rubber piece that fits your ear - Box it comes in is a nice premium carry-around case Cons: - Type-C could have been a little longer for large desk use - Packaging... the clear plastic covering inside is a little annoying if you are planning on using the box as a case - Play/Pause/Volume controls on the earbuds take some time getting used to Overall, a nearly 2-3x improvement from my last anker earbuds [2019 Upgraded, Anker Soundcore Liberty Neo True Wireless Earbuds] would buy this version again for myself or family members.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing earbuds! But..
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are comfortable and sound great but there is a hissing/white noise in the background when playing video or listening to music. You can’t really notice it when listening to music at a high volume but watching a video like people talking with a quiet background you will definitely notice it. Specially listening to podcast. I’ve had very cheap wireless earbuds that don’t make any hiss/white noise in the background. So this being a $100 product with this issue is very disappointing. Hopefully this gets fixed in the future. Anker, you need to do better for a price like this. 🙁
customer_reviews.author: Lee Eclevia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent headphone, great sound and fit
customer_reviews.text: So far I used it to listen music and videos, very good quality of sound across all ranges without using the equalizer app. With the piano equalizer, the sound improves a little in the mid-low frequencies. The fit is nice using the earpad that came with it. The case is also nice in quality build and apperance. Noise cancellation is pasive, so it will depend on the individual fitting. I have not use the mic a lot to actually make an assessment. The times I used it was ok. Personally I am very happy with the earbud. Only cons is the price, $60 would be more in line with mid price competitors.
customer_reviews.author: pablo varela

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality. Other features need work. Survived washer and dryer!
customer_reviews.text: - Sound quality VERY good and LOUD for Bluetooth. - Whenever I'm on a call with someone they almost always have trouble hearing me. I don't use these for calls anymore becaue it's so bad. - They stay put during runs and workouts - The limited controls are pretty annoying. I'd rather have physical buttons. - Wish there was a hear through feature. - Great battery life Overall these are solid headphones for listening to music and working out. That being said they are a little pricey considering the other features need some work. Also i just recently left them in my pocket they went though the washer and dryer. Surprisingly they still work!
customer_reviews.author: The Internet

customer_reviews.title: HOT GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: Not at all a true competitor to the AirPods or AirPods Pro. Sizzling highs, over pronounced bass, lackluster miss. The touch controls are clunky at best, and the app isn’t even worthy of being called clunky. I’m an Anker fan, I had really high hopes for these and they let me down big time. Oh, and don’t even think of using these for phone calls. Everyone I spoke with said it sounded like I was in a tunnel. Sending these back after about 8 hours of owning them. Total waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny P.

customer_reviews.title: Not for Conversations!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you're hoping to use these for both podcast listening & phone conversations :: FORGET IT :: I searched & searched for a pair of bluetooth earbuds that would work for everything & these were supposed to be "the ones". Unfortunately, the only time I could use them for phone conversations was when I was in a completely silent space. THEY PICK UP EVERYTHING even the turn signal in my car clicking OVER MY OWN VOICE!!! So disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: April Welch

customer_reviews.title: Great listening, well designed earbuds
customer_reviews.text: For the price, these earbuds are an excellent buy. After dealing with a series of malfunctioning Apple BeatsX for 3 years (reliably failing after 6-12 months of light regular use), I’m impressed by the ease of use, sound quality and reliable Bluetooth connection of the Soundcore Liberty Air 2. I mostly listen to podcasts but music is also rewarding, with just enough bass and midrange to make listenIng to jazz, classical and rock rewarding. The design of the storage/charging case is efficient and handy to use. Have owned them for 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Chas

customer_reviews.title: Had issues Pairing...comany made up for it!
customer_reviews.text: Updated Review: The company reached out to me to send a replacement pair. The replacement pair work extremely well. The sound is awesome, the microphone is decent, and there's an app you can download if you want to change the equalizer or change the settings of the button. Changing from 1-Start to 5-stars Original Review: Bad issues pairing with my phone after repeated attempts and talking to Customer Service. At this price, you'd expect a bit better quality. I would be willing to try again if I could be guaranteed a pair that works.
customer_reviews.author: William McKibbin

customer_reviews.title: Call-centric customers only!
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT for immersive music listening. Bass crackles in hip hop at 55% volume. Mids are decent. Highs are crystal clear perfect! As good as my custom molded Plantronic EC3s. I can see why they last so long, because their drivers are teeny tiny and less power going to these. Anyway, will keep them since i use them for calls most of the time and will not be using these for noise-cancelling or for heavy rock or hip hop listening anytime soon. I will stick with my MPOW's for running, and total body workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Dromodor

customer_reviews.title: Dead less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Initially they worked beautifully and I was very happy with my purchase. The sound was very clear and app was easy to use but for one of them to not even work within two months of reviving them, I don't know if i would buy anything Anker again. I trusted the brand to make a reliable product. Due to corona I been working from home and I have been using them everyday. For the Anker Soundcore Liberty Air 2 Wireless Earbuds to stop working in the middle of a meeting, that was unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Ahluwagr

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and fit, cheaper than the well known competitor
customer_reviews.text: These sound great and the fit was spot-on for me without trying out any of the other sized tips. Properly pairing them out of the box was an issue -- I didn't get audio out of both of them. After figuring out the pairing reset process they worked fine. Download the SouncCore app -- mine updated the firmware to fix bugs right away, and it has an option for tuning the sound to your specific hearing profile. I can't say much about noise cancelling, but the room has the eerie quiet sensation of noise cancellation, so I assume it works OK.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Beale

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is amazing
customer_reviews.text: Soundcore Liberty Air 2 Wireless Earbuds are engineered precisely. I was able to pair it with my iPhone within less than 2 minutes. Soundcore app has taken the product to the very next level. I am impressed with the sound quality and so many options for equalizers. These earbuds changed the way I hear music again. Snuggle fit with deep bass and options to fine tune from low to high frequencies is a big plus. Besides the printed manual, soundcore app also has a built-in user manual. App is so powerful to detect and upgrade the firmware. I am very happy and satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Surya

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: Product came defective and unable to update firmware. When contacted for a replacement unit, company will not issue a replacement until they receive the defective unit. Now I am sitting here waiting for another week when I have an upcoming business meeting. Such a horrible customer service. Extremely disappointing. They may have a good to sub par product and some are overhyped, their customer service is worthless. Deal with a more reputable company for a change. I’m returning the replacement and will not want it again for wasting my time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow, not a good wow either
customer_reviews.text: I rarely post reviews but I bought these for my partner as a gift and am thoroughly disappointed. We just spent a half hour on Christmas morning trying to get both buds to pair with her iPhone 11 Pro... nope! What an awful experience, Bluetooth pairing should be the most simple aspect, basic day 1 stuff for a tech company. Can’t even speak to the sound quality or anything else because they can’t pair at the same time. Brutal, do not buy these, all the 5 star reviews must be fake!
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased dozens of Bluetooth wireless earbuds over the years. I was gifted a pair of Apple AirBuds but they would not stay in my ears. I purchased these because they had different sized ear tips to enable the listener to have a custom fit. If I were to lose these earbuds today, I would order another set as soon as possible. They work with my iPhone, my Macbook Pro, my Lenovo Yoga, and my Google Pixel2 XL. I whole-heartedly recommend these earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Rockabilly Reject

customer_reviews.title: Most convoluted setup I've ever seen
customer_reviews.text: I can't imagine who designed these things. The fit is great, sound is just decent, but the setup and use is so overly complicated. Maybe I'm just used to the Apple ones - a few taps, etc. but these are tap once for option a, tap 3 times for option b, hold 8 seconds on the left one for option c, etc. Too much hassle - and they don't really work as a 'pair' like you'd expect.
customer_reviews.author: Earth Dude

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: The headphones work without issue about 40% of the time. For the most part you can expect that you'll need to disconnect and reconnect the headphones several times. I've had the headphones only connect one when I take out both, connect the left when I've taken out the right (and vice versa), had to reconnect because of poor mic quality, or poor audio quality (for phone conversations), in addition to the plain ole take them out and hear nothing until you realize you have to reset it AGAIN. I love Anker products, but this is not a pleasant experience to use. I wish we were back in an era of headphone jacks in cellphones
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Anker disappointed me on this one
customer_reviews.text: First of all, i love Anker products, from the portable charges, to the connectors to the cables. however, they are still a bit behind in regards to headphones. I tried the first pair i purchased, and at the beginning it seemed to be good but afterwards it was disappointing. I've ordered a replacement. I hope it works out. I'll update accordingly. Update: same issue. not what i expected from Anker. I still like their other products.
customer_reviews.author: Franz Gomero

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, noise cancelling, and NO bass boost
customer_reviews.text: I was very skeptical of buying these, given all the brands out there and that I’d never bought a pair for myself. Also, as a jazz lover, finding earbuds that do NOT boost bass is nearly impossible. (I’d like to hear all the instruments on that Coltrane solo, please.) These earbuds deliver a full, rich sound, cancel out surrounding sound very well, and have phenomenal battery life. Totally happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Dizzy Broad

customer_reviews.title: Clear, accurate audio; comfortable fit; highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I give Anker's Soundcore Liberty Air 2 earbuds a 5-star even though I predict the next iteration that I predict will be another winner. Anker designs and makes high quality products, whether a power adapter or a cable or earbuds. I tried a number of other highly touted earbuds before settling on the Liberty Air 2. None had the pristine accuracy of audio reproduction or the comfortable fit... none. Without naming competitors, just let me say that the Liberty Air 2 earbuds will beat others costing twice or three times as much. Lastly, a word about customer support at Anker... it is outstanding. Responsive, helpful and prompt.
customer_reviews.author: David Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life; great sound
customer_reviews.text: Great battery life; great sound; the Soundcore app enables you to tune the sound to match your specific hearing profile. One downside for the Soundcore buds is that the documentation is hopeless - poor pictograms printed in 2pt font in light blue on a white background. Agh!. I did have a lot of problems pairing both buds. Both Left and Right appear for pairing on your phone (or whatever device). I blew a lot of time trying to pair both to my phone. Wrong. You have to pair them to each other (which they do automatically) and then pair *one* to your phone. very nonintuitive. Apart from that frustration I'm super pleased with the quality and price point!
customer_reviews.author: Boomzilla

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Nice headphones, good ear fit, great sound, good battery life (varied by day and ear L R piece though, not sure why) They said great four microphones for voice, but working with Teams or Zoom, everybody said my sound was bad and broken. Tested with Laptop and Samsung S8, both the same mic performance. As my main focus was for work - good mic - I have sent them back and bought the Samsung Galaxy Buds, sound and mic perf (Zoom/Teams) perfect with S8 phone - and battery life is 9 hours (on day one of my test) In summary if you want some good quality ear buds for working out, then you cannot go wrong with these buds
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kinder

customer_reviews.title: Terrible call quality on the other end
customer_reviews.text: I tried using these to call someone the day i got them. it was at night in my house with two kids sound asleep. He heard EVERY STEP I TOOK. i thought maybe they are too isolated so i turned on a sink to see if it would catch that and cancel it... NOPE. These wouldn't be good to make calls in a library because the other end will hear the pages turning. Really disappointed as i usually buy real cheap headphones and this is one of the more expensive ones i have bought. they were moderately comfy, after installing the app the sound quality was decent. noise canceling is less comfortable than 'active' alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: Both pods would never connect at same time.
customer_reviews.text: From day one my daughter could not get both pods to connect to her iphone xr. We have many other bluetooth devices we have connected to her phone so its not our first rodeo. The instruction page was very vague but we followed the instructions to a T and we can only get one bud to connect at a time. The return policyvwas only a month so after trying to get them to work properly over and over we ran out of time to exchange. Now stuck with $99 non working pods. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Good when they work
customer_reviews.text: Received this item twice. I like them, sound is good with the app, fit is comfortable, lightweight. HOWEVER, 1st item: background noise cancelation did not work whatsoever. Emphasized all background noise even when I was in areas that were not that loud. Called into customer service using the earbuds and the rep offered a replacement immediately. 2nd item: Replacement came used, missing parts such as charging cord and silicone tips. These earbuds had a different technical malfunction, crackling/static noise. Not sure if I want to try again for a 3rd time. Returning both.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: A bit disapointing... Sounds like a transistor radio in your ear
customer_reviews.text: I got my dad a set of these and shipped them to him in the southern US. He said he was pleased with them. They went on sale so I picked up a set for me to use on my work iPhone... Spotify sounds like you have a transistor radio on your head. Downloaded the companion app for iOS, updated the firmware, messed with the sound/eq options, no change. Tried different ear seals as well... I do have the Anker SoundCore Liberty 2 Pro's on my personal Android phone and they sound AWESOME... Not sure if these are defective or not, but they work ok for calls so for the price I guess I will hold on to them.
customer_reviews.author: SithTracy

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: I love this! I can use both or ileither one. Love the battery life and carrying/charging case. Wide range of interchangeable ear gellies. Sound out of the box is too tinnie for my liking of sound. After customization via app, sound hits close to spot. Bass puchy, not boomy, claers are just right(no more excessive treble). Wish the volume could be a tad louder but it will do. Noise cancelation freJs me out a little, not used to it before this headset. Sound quality for calls and music are great! This has replaced a same category set of $30(garbage) prior to that, LG junk of $150. I am happy with this set! Have owned for less than a month...
customer_reviews.author: Manny

customer_reviews.title: Nice build quality but do not fit my ears
customer_reviews.text: These earphones get rave reviews but this is completely dependent on ear fitment. I have discovered that my ears do not fit silicone eartips without the additional support of wing tips. So the sound for me is terrible without any bass and the earphones fall out with any head movement. Fitment issues aren’t really the fault of Anker though. Their build quality is very good. As nice as any Apple product. The app is also well designed.
customer_reviews.author: Thrones

customer_reviews.title: Left ear bud cuts in and out constantly. No fixes yet
customer_reviews.text: Ok so these are my second anker headphones purchase. I had the original liberty air until they stopped holding a charge. Loved those so thought I would go for the newer model when I needed to replace my old ones. Welp, they were great for a couple of weeks then the left headphone would cut in and out, now the left one sounds like your on a horrible connection and you hear bits and pieces of words and sentences. It's super annoying. I really want to love these. My old pair was amazing! I have unpaired and paired again. Forgot device and reinstalled. It's a bummer that I spent so much on these for them not to work.
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: awkwardly uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The specs for this headset look very impressive. However neither I nor my wife could get them to stay comfortably in our ears. My ears are large and my wife's are small... None of the tips helped to secure the earbuds' position. I ordered Anker and Klipssh for my wife to choose from, planning to return the other pair. Both earbuds cost the same $99, both feature aptX. Klipsch have slightly longer battery life, metallic charging case and a tad heavier. Anker promised wireless charging and noise cancellation. Yet, my wife chose Klipsch. And the sound is incomparably better there. Your mileage may vary :)
customer_reviews.author: brumko

customer_reviews.title: Good Earbuds. Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these earbuds for my daughter. The pair we initially received had a small stain on the charging case. After contacting customer service, the customer service representative (Michelle) arranged for a replacement set and a way for me to return the stained item. The process was very easy and my daughter is very pleased with the earbuds. I have listened to them also and found them to have good quality sound and acceptable noise cancellation. I also ended up ordering another pair of Anker earbuds (Soundcore Life P2) for my other daughter because of the good experience with these.
customer_reviews.author: Simple Mom

customer_reviews.title: Been a Week...
customer_reviews.text: It's only been a week but wow, these are awesome. Call quality is remarkable, the music quality is great (unless you're a Beats fan and love heavy bass), easy to use, and the battery just keeps going. I only wish they had the transparent mode, but either earbud can be used at a time so that helps. Two small issues. First was the initial pairing wouldn't work correctly but resetting them using a 60 second YouTube video worked. Second, the inserts that came with them were not comfortable for me so I had to use other ones from a different brand. Overall, I'm glad I didn't spend more money on a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Decent battery, average sound.
customer_reviews.text: If you're an audiophile, look elsewhere. These headphones are mediocre when it comes to sound reproduction, but still very good for this price point. Where these do shine is the overall package. They are decently comfortable to wear for light exercise, have decent battery life, and the charging case only makes it better. Some issues I've encountered so far has to deal with touch sensors and connection. They don't always work like you think they should, possibly due to user error. The lack of feedback on press makes you second guess your input. Also, sometimes one earbud may not connect to the source. This can be remedied by rebooting the earbud, but still an annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Justin D Wai

customer_reviews.title: Great Airbus alternative
customer_reviews.text: Earbud sound quality is amazing, much better quality than its predecessor. Touch controls are a bit iffy, sometimes they work mostly they don't. Comfort-wise, super comfortable much more than the Apple airpods. Overall really great earbuds
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Yesssss! Buy these over AirPods
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I loved my boyfriend's pair so much, that I had to get my own. Super great sound quality and blocks out literally all the sounds from your environment. Battery life is great and I can probably go days without recharging them. Very comfy in your ear and stays put as you workout. I'm still blown away by the quality for how low the price is.
customer_reviews.author: PaperedDoll

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love nearly everything about these headphones, they sound amazing and connect fairly fast. The left too right connection trade off if you switch eat buds works pretty well. They auto pair both sides individually when you pair initially. The build quality on the case is top notch as well... I have 2 gripes both a not big. One is I would have liked to see a rubber stopper on the charging port. I also would like to see wireless ear buds with multipoint connection support. At the time of this writing however nearly no manufacturers including Anker offer this.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Friedlein

customer_reviews.title: Great Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are great and have an amazing battery life and a sleek look. It charges wirelessly and via (Usb c) which is a big deal for me. (Update) I got contacted by Anker’s customers service and got offered a replacement unit, however after a couple of software updates the original buds seemed to be improved and my main issue with them was addressed. The biggest con was the mic (during phone calls) seemed to be muffled, but its fixed now. Anyways I’m giving them 5 stars now and I highly recommend them to anyone shopping for a good quality wireless earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Abaamer

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the price!!!
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds are a good deal especially when you consider the price and features. The call quality is good and you won’t be disappointed. I tested It by calling some friends and everyone said they didn’t notice I was using earbuds. However, there is a caveat though, in order to enjoy these earbuds you need to do 2 important things: 1) pick the right eartips to fit your eardrums 2) use the Soundcore app and play with the equalizer or the earID to choose the perfect sound for you. Without those two you might not enjoy these good earbuds
customer_reviews.author: Maj082

customer_reviews.title: Great for phone conversations, not so much for music.
customer_reviews.text: I like to wear these when I go out walking; no wires! Sometimes I listen to discussion podcasts, other times I call someone, and sometimes I listen to music. The app has a nice customizable equalizer and preset ones, but these particular earbuds cannot handle the bass cranked. That causes them to distort pretty badly. I imagine one of the other Soundcore sets is better for music, but those probably don't have mics for phone, and I don't like the bulky earbuds. I do like the Liberty units because they're small and light and not bulky.
customer_reviews.author: APF

customer_reviews.title: Can't use with more than one device
customer_reviews.text: I want to like these buds. They look good, sound good and they're a great price. However, if you use them one more than one device they are very frustrating to use. They must be disconnected from one device and then reconnected on the desired device. More often than not this is not an easy process. If you use them on just one device, like a phone, these are great. If you switch between Mac, iPhone, iPad, etc., these will drive you crazy. I would return them, but I messed around trying to get them to work for a month and missed the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny Minchillo

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome
customer_reviews.text: I got to admit.... This product is amazing. If you cannot use apple earpods because of them not staying in your ear, get these right away.. they are awesome and cheaper than apples costly listing products. You can use them individually, the battery life is great and most importantly they sound terrific.. please get these right away if your on the fence. This product is built well to..I should have perchased these on the first day launched. Soundcore you have done it once again. I'm a happy customer. thank you for giving customers great products without breaking the bank. Awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jiggamane

customer_reviews.title: Really Liked these And wanted them to last. But they fell out.
customer_reviews.text: I really loved them for about 2 weeks. Sound was great, call clarity was great. I was Really hoping these would be my go-to daily buds. Unfortunately they fit my ear poorly and the right earbud fell out while jogging and got lost down a storm drain in the first week. I tried using it in mono mode with just the left earbud but that doesn't operate at all the way. Sigh. I’m not rich, and these were a gift:splurge for myself. I can’t get another pair right now.
customer_reviews.author: CG3

customer_reviews.title: Love Anker... Buuuut
customer_reviews.text: Almost the ones. I love the design. So lightweight, elegant and sleek. So comfortable. But wayyy too much bass, treble is way to harsh. Nothing seems balanced. Sound stage is sloppy. I love Anker. But they really need to hire a sound engineer like the company 1more does. Calls are decent. My people on the other end say I sound a bit harsh and treble-ee. Background noise seems to be heard more than my own voice. Again, I love Anker. If they can solidify call quality on these, and engineer the mids, highs and bass quite a bit. I'd buy these twice over.
customer_reviews.author: R.Edward

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews that said they "exceeded expectations for cheap earbuds". Not sure why $99 is considered cheap for earbuds, because I sure don't think that. I think they perform ok for the price. I suppose earbuds can only perform so well, being tiny little speakers that stick in your ears. And I guess I was hoping they would stick better (earbuds have never worked that well for me- weird ears I guess), but they didn't. Constant adjusting. Decent sound. Decent noise cancellation. Battery life is pretty good. They're fine.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron P. LeCocq

customer_reviews.title: Great Sounding Affordable and Comfortable Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I love the rubber tips on this style of earbud. It holds the earbud in place well and provides some noise cancellation. I bought this 10 months ago. Recently I had trouble hearing sound from the left earbud. It would play, but it was sooo quiet you could not hear it. I contacted Soundcore support and we tried several options. Ultimately, it would not work. They asked me to send the the unit back to them and they sent me a new replacement. It works great now. Great company that stands behind their product. Thanks Soundcore.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a pair of these for almost 3 weeks now and I am using them with an iPhone 11. They comfortable and they sound great... when you can get them to work. You put them in the case and sometimes they don’t disconnect from the phone. Sometimes one charges and the other doesn’t and it’s not always the same one that gives the problem. Sometimes they won’t pair together and only one will pair with the phone and if you spend any time using only one you can be guaranteed that they won’t pair together next time.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with TV transmitter
customer_reviews.text: I'm upping my rating to 3 stars after my interaction with their tech support. I've been emailing with a real person who actually cares and doesn't just send a bunch of canned responses. My problem is the earbuds disconnect and reconnect every 2 minutes and 12 seconds with the Bluetooth transmitter I have connected to my TV. They work fine with my phone. They are issuing me a refund. Sound quality is above average but not amazing. Note the noise cancelling feature merely refers to the microphones and not to the earbuds themselves.
customer_reviews.author: Brad M.

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds, custom eartips may not fit case
customer_reviews.text: I found that the eartips that came with these EarBuds didn't fit very well to my ear. I have some other eartips that didn't come with these earbuds that fit the shape of my ear very well so I would love to use them and they fit on these earbuds BUT then the earbuds don't fit when you put both earbuds in the charging case. They push against each other so the charging contacts don't connect at the bottom. If you're the kind of person who usually needs custom eartips, try something like the Liberty 2 which has a case more accommodating for custom tips while charging.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Mchie Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Game changer earbuds
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many (if not all) leading wireless earphones over the years. Each of them has quirks, shortcomings and challenges. The liberty air 2 earbuds are as close to perfect as I have found. The battery life is so strong that I don't ever have to worry about charging. I charge the case when I think about it but after daily use for the past 3 weeks I have never had an issue with battery. The quality is clear. The ability to listen/hear through either ear is fantastic. The fit is very snug and rarely needs to be reset. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Phone call microphone is cheap and terrible
customer_reviews.text: Unlike the Apple version, these headphones are *terrible* for phone calls. Friends tell me it sounds like I'm in a deep tunnel, pixelated, and generally terrible sound. Noise cancellation doesn't work - in fact, outside sounds are "amplified" instead of cancelled. I'll try to return or re-sell. Anker has great speakers, but too bad they were too cheap on the microphone for these units. :(
customer_reviews.author: Savvy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Small and protable Long range Great sound Good app Cons: Case is flimsy Overall these have been a great set of wireless earbuds. They have exceptional sound and after tuning them with the available app the Sound was even better. The Bluetooth connectivity has been extremely solid with good range from my devices. My only complaint is that the case is a bit flimsy, as the top is easily opened luckily the magnets that hold the buds in place are pretty strong.
customer_reviews.author: ministermtc

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but hard to pair
customer_reviews.text: they sound great, better than the previous generation. However, in my experience they are a bit flaky pairing with my Google Pixel 2. I get drop outs sometimes, or it is simply very slow to pair and I have to fumble with the controls. With the previous generation of this soundcore headset, the pairing was so fast that when I took it out of the case and lifted it to my ear, pairing would be complete by the time I had it inserted. So at that level I consider these a step backwards. What good are Bluetooth headsets that you can't pair with, no matter how good they sound?
customer_reviews.author: culture vulture

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I don't have experience with other wireless earbuds, but this is super easy to pair with multiple devices and battery life is great. I charge about once a week, of course usage varies. But they are snug in my ears, I run on treadmill and it's much better than my other corded ones that use to pop out or get tangled on the handlebars.
customer_reviews.author: Jujubeans

customer_reviews.title: These perfectly filled my need for non-Apple earbuds at a fraction of the cost!
customer_reviews.text: To put it simply, these earbuds are GLORIOUS! Sound quality is superb, and though noise cancellation is passive by sealing your ear canal, it makes for an incredibly private listening experience. Syncing them to my Note 9 was a snap and the SoundID app provides some very interesting and effective adjustments. Wired and Qi charging worked well, and battery life is great. The quick-charge feature is a big deal for me, giving my flat-dead earbuds an extra 2-3 hours of listening in just a few minutes of charging. As an avid Android user, having inexpensive non-Apple buds that can hang side-by-side with AirPod Pros has been a real treat!
customer_reviews.author: Ian B.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 35 days.
customer_reviews.text: After 35 days of daily use, I experienced inability to pair the devices with my phone. After struggle one would pair or maybe the other, but not both. Additionally, the right earphone stopped charging and became inoperable. Lastly, if you have more than 1 phone, the pairing experience is poor. You have to turn off bluetooth with any other device that has connected to it before before you can switch to the device you want to use. Customer service is replacing them but still disappointed with the product overall. Wish I had gotten something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones, Terrible Microphone
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this earbuds to be able to talk with friends and family on the phone during quarantine, but was unable to. The microphone makes such loud and high-pitched sounds to the listener that each and every single person I ever attempted to communicate with using this set begged me to un-attach them and just hold my phone as before. The few times I listened to music they worked perfectly fine, but I had purchased them to be used for phone calls, not listening to music and was very disappointed in them.
customer_reviews.author: DWR

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life is bad
customer_reviews.text: I have had these since April and the battery life is crap. I spend all day on the phone and I cannot get 1/2 a day of work before these need charge. They say 7 hours but am lucky to get 4. Support asked how loud they are used. I would challenge if the 7 hour time is with them on but with very low volume then that needs to be disclosed. In the end, better price than Apple AirPods. Expected something better for the price tag on these. If you know you will listen for a short time then great. If you plan to use them for daily conf. calls, then look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Kodet

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Anker / Soundcore do it again. This company consistently makes great products at super competitive prices. I own power banks, ear buds, bluetooth speakers and now these ear buds and I've been thrilled with all of their products. I love the app and adjustable controls. The sound is great, the fit works well for me. The case is small and holds plenty of extra power. Battery life on the buds is quite good. The buds paired easily with my phone the first time and they immediately pair thereafter. I paid $80+ tax for these and I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brett C.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and customer service
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Anker Soundcore Liberty Air 2 earbuds for my 17 year old son. He did some research and asked for this pair. They did not disappoint. He loves the color (black and red) and the way they feel in his ear. After about 9 months we did have issues with the sound in one of the earbuds. I contacted Anker and they immediately replied back to me an apology. Their customer service is excellent. They sent us a new pair quickly and followed up with me a few weeks later to see how they were working. Thank you. Anker. Great products and good customer service means I am a lifelong customer.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs5mitty

customer_reviews.title: Decently loud wireless option
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the sound quality on a different $50 pair was dreadful. The step up is significant and I am fairly happy. Overall I am still annoyed that I have to spend $100 to get the same quality a $30 wired pair would provide. I don't think we should give manufacturers a break on this because this change is being forced on us Pros Okay quality at higher volumes (5/10) USB c charging Comfortable Easy to pair Good range Cons Funky airpod-like design
customer_reviews.author: Noe Valenzuela

customer_reviews.title: Eh... UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: Sound is mediocre at-best, although volume is plentiful. No real bass. UPDATE - After some incredible customer service from Anker, they helped me understand that user error was the primary issue. I would update the review from 3 to 4 stars based on performance alone, but a product is more than just the hardware and Anker was willing to do whatever it took to make me happy. That is a definite rarity in technology products and if I could give them 10 stars for being a great company, I would!
customer_reviews.author: Great One

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price!
customer_reviews.text: PROs + Case and buds looks good and no cheap + Charges with any UsbA-C and C-C... And wireless! + Sound is fine but bot perfect. There are different EQ presets or you can custom to your liking. + Earbuds are independent. + Battery life was great at least this first week. + App is good built, has many options, and different ways to get support. CONs - Wish it had a volume slider - Call quality is not great. People didnt hear me fine.
customer_reviews.author: krlosRD

customer_reviews.title: The best earbuds hands down!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best earbuds I have tried for phonecalls. Usually something has to give: phone calls or the music quality, but not here. Sound quality is amazing, phonecall quality is awesome. I use it for phone calls for the most part, but every time I listen to music, it puts the smile on my face from the quality of sound. Highly recommend those earbuds. Battery life is superior and the build quality is very good. Connection from one earbud to two, or to the other one is seemless. I have tried all the other earbuds from the soundcore lineup, those were the best overall.
customer_reviews.author: Balu

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, better zoom sound quality!
customer_reviews.text: I use the earbuds for multiple listenings. Music, podcasts and also for workouts. Though not built best for workouts as they don’t stay in ear with certain activities. However, with that said, these ear buds are everything and more, fraction of the price of Apple and in my opinion better quality and look. Music sounds great and with this pandemic, my zoom meetings also have become easier with crystal clear sound rather than my laptop speakers. Even with the workout issue I’m giving it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Generally Good
customer_reviews.text: These do what they should do, although there are a coupple of minor annoyances: -Getting them placed in your ears correctly sometimes accidentially pushes a "button" which can cause unwanted effects -The USB cable attaches from the bottom, which means if you want to leave them plugged in, you can't stand the case up as the picture shows -I have had the left ear drop out for no apparent reason. The fix is to put it back in the case and close it for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Vodil

customer_reviews.title: Great ‘Air Pods’ alternative
customer_reviews.text: I mainly wanted a set of Bluetooth headphones for calls and call quality. These meet that and more. Other than an initial hiccup out of the box (support had me fixed in about 20 min), I have zero complaints. Good sound quality, easy to use, good battery life, good noise cancellation, clear voice on calls, etc. I really have no complaints other than sometimes the noise cancellation works TOO well and someone startles me when they touch my arm to get my attention.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wolfley

customer_reviews.title: The best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only earphones I would buy over and over after Apple AirPods, period. Build quality is surprisingly great. I been using Anker products for few years now and most of the times I am a satisfied customer. This earphones is no exemption. Case is soft touch rubberized material. Wireless charging is an added benefit. Best part in earphones itself is that it’s not one size fit all situation, you can change the rubber piece accordingly. Battery life is amazing. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: IFILMIC

customer_reviews.title: Best one's I've purchased!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these just about everyday since New years, so for about 3 months. The call quality is great, the sound is fantastic. I am still trying to find the right size of the ear piece to keep them in my ear a little better, but really...for the money, this is the best pair you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Jared G.

customer_reviews.title: Best music headphone but if you want to take a call look for something else.
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect music noise canceling headphones ever but if I need to take a call that’s when these headphones suffer. They are great when you wanna listen to some something but when you try and take a call that is another story. The headphones will pick up everything, I mean every little background noise that you might be able to hear but the caller will. It also seems to be lacking with the connectivity. I can never hear the full sentence the caller is every trying to say because it cuts in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Utsumi

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I use these earbuds on a daily basis for working out and wearing while outside doing lawn work and walking. The noise cancelling is good and the sound quality is great. I love that they pair automatically with whatever device I'm using at the time - I go from my Peloton Bike to my Phone and they work seamlessly on my iPhone 11. I can use them several hours a day and still only charge them every few days. I also like that you can customize the settings for the modes on the earbuds themselves! Genius! They also stay in place SUPER well! I loved them so much that I bought my husband a pair!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Word of Caution before Buying
customer_reviews.text: EDIT/UPDATE IF you want a good product, at a good price, BUT might have to deal with a return, then these are for you. AKA if you are willing to sacrifice some time for a good product these are for you ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Original Review They sound great....when they work I have had 2 major issues with these headphones. 1) They have problems getting both to connect sometimes the BIGGER PROBLEM 2) The right earbud no longer charges (about 2 months of use). I have tried to clean out the case to make sure there is nothing in the case, I have cleaned the contacts, nothing works. So now I only have half of the headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Medlin

customer_reviews.title: Great Air Pod alternatives if they actually fit your ear
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality for days , phone calls are crystal clear. This product comes with more than enough ear tips for all the ears in the world but mine. I have rotated through all the tips and even ordered some additional ones (extra small) thinking that would make it better. I just cant get these to stay in, some days I can and they work like a charm but I never know if its going to be one of those days or not. BUt Like I said before if they fit you will not need another pair of bluetooth headphones ever.
customer_reviews.author: Lamont Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Best sub 100 TWS so far.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great, but I've been told there was a lot of background noise in calls both on phone and in Skype or Teams conference calls. People can hear me pounding on the keyboard or clicking my mouse. However, I like that you can use these buds one at a time making you situationally aware (like my wife talking) when doing so, aside from a quick swap when battery runs out on one. You forget it's in your ear. It's that light. It doesn't auto switch when paired to multiple devices, but re-pairing is simple enough. Range is surprisingly good!
customer_reviews.author: The Real Me

customer_reviews.title: Omg! These are the best!!
customer_reviews.text: As someone who doesn't own an iphone but liked the idea of air pods and wanted something similar for my galaxy s9, I stumbled upon these glorious ear buds! I love everything about these anker soundcore liberty Air 2s. Connecting them to my phone was super simple and easy. I'm so glad I decided to purchase these. The sound quality is amazing and so is the battery life. The noise cancelation seems to be pretty good so far and I'm excited to try them out on an air plane for my upcoming trip.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Better sound quality than airpods pro (hear me out)
customer_reviews.text: I used like a hundred different earphones, earbuds, airpods. I've tried JBL, apple, Bose, Samsung, Sony so I know what I'm talking about. The sound quality is on par with Bose and is way better than airpods pro. Initially, I didn't like the sound and was quite disappointed. But then I realized that the earbuds didn't fit my ears perfectly. I changed the tips and next was magic. I use bass boost equilizer in soundcore app which suited my preference. Of course, there are many other equilizer options available. I bought these after reading about it on soundguys. If you value sound quality, go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Ravi Uchiha

customer_reviews.title: Good packaging, Used product
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived in the expected Amazon boxing and sealed within what we would expect to be a Soundcore/Anker signature boxing style. I could not complain about that. I was not able to perform any checks on the device. I had noticed that the tape sealing the box closed had the appearance of previously being opened. There was a bent edge of the plastic where it was 'closed' back together. I was assured that this was the case when I noticed fingerprints on the plastic inside the plastic housing of the headphones. The headphones appeared to have some sort of lint stuck on them.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good buy no regrets
customer_reviews.text: First initial impressions after first day of use. Product feels good in hand. Feels very durable. Easy to pair up with phone and app. It doesn’t have active noise cancellation but passive noise cancellation is good if you select the right ear tips and comfortable. Sound preference is very customizable. Took a phone call on a single earbud and call didn’t seem to be good caller said they had heard a lot of background noise. Took another call using both earbuds and call quality was definitely better. Definitely recommend these for purchase
customer_reviews.author: Chefferton

customer_reviews.title: Battery life not good and they won't stay turned off
customer_reviews.text: The soundcore app to customize sound was very lack luster. The sound for audio of music or podcast was fine, however for having "3 microphones" it does not have great voice quality for folks on the other end. My biggest problem is the battery life. A full charge and only 2 hours later, no use just on stand by they are at 60%. I turn them off and they turn themselves back on just hanging on a neck band (using that to keep from losing when not in use.) disappointed and will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis K.

customer_reviews.title: They have potential but I wasn’t satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for these earbuds heard good reviews but this wasn’t the case for me. Pros-the design looks great.AirPod like earbuds with their own personal style. Good sound and adjusting EQ setting(even Grammy award winning producer setting). Cons-Had a lot of trouble pairing them.( I’m very tech savvy).When I finally did get them to pair they worked for a while then the left bud stopped working.Very disappointed. Also for some reason they will slip out of your ear ALOT ,even when I exchanged ear tips.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Bonner

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid. Very few gripes
customer_reviews.text: Biggest thing was pairing them. Downloaded app. Chatted with customer service. They said to u pair, put in case, press button on case for 8 seconds until flashes red. Right bud will flash quickly. Pair in settings, no need to manually pair Left side it'll ask automatically. After that. I turned off the auto pause feature in the app because I don't like it. And switched to the second smallest buds. Wireless charging case. The only thing I want is a find my buds and case feature because they are EASY to lose.
customer_reviews.author: R. Baird

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like these
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these. They had some great reviews on YouTube. But the Bluetooth connection is sketchy at best. It will connect, but not always play back any sound. The double tap is close to useless. If they had a triple tap option instead on the long press that you're never quite sure if it's working is useless. I so wish it would connect with two devises at once, but it doesn't. When it works sound and battery are fine. But as earbuds go its very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: dreamsoffire

customer_reviews.title: Great battery, very convenient, poor fit and less reliable startup
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of Soundcore LIberty Neo, but one bud went walkies. The LIberty Air 2 fixes the main complaints I had with the Neo (unwieldily case, and you can only use the right bud solo) but introduces two problems (the fit on these aren't great - they slip out a lot - and they don't connect reliably at startup). Both these are a letdown after having the Neos for a year. Overall, they're OK, but I spent more than 2x what I paid for the Neos and it wasn't really worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C. Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: Don't ....
customer_reviews.text: This device is very good, however, I have experienced connection issues in my phone calls, and this is very frustrating, Too many alternatives, be wise, and be safe. -- Update: This device not worth it, it has serious connectivity issues. Customer Service exchange few emails with me, basically hoping I change my review in order to send my a new pair, please don’t do it, there are many good & best options for half of the price....
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Otaola

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is not great, not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised these have such amazing reviews. They are fine, but every time I use them I feel like I need to adjust the sound. For comparison I normally use airpods (regular not the Pro for daily normal use), Bose over ear QII (for when I want noise cancelling) and Aftershocks Titanium (for running). I would say the sound quality on these are the worst of the ones I normally use. I bought these because I wanted a spare set at my work for calls and I read that these are comparable to the airpods pro, but these just aren't great. They are decently comfortable and they function fine, the sound is just lacking.
customer_reviews.author: TM Anderson

product_meta.title: Anker Soundcore Liberty Air 2 Wireless Earbuds, Diamond-Inspired Drivers, Bluetooth Earphones, 4 Mics, Noise Reduction, 28H Playtime, HearID, Bluetooth 5, Wireless Charging, for Calls, Home Office
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackKey Features

Sound with Exceptional Accuracy and Clarity: The diamond-inspired drivers are lightweight, yet rigid for precise sound reproduction and extended treble and bass. 
aptX Audio: Ensures lossless sound transfer when streaming media from your device. 
HearID Tailored Sound: Maps your hearing sensitivity across multiple frequencies to create custom EQ settings for a truly personalized listening experience. 
22 EQ Modes: Use the Soundcore App to choose from a vast range of customized settings to get the most out of your favorite genres. 
Crystal-Clear Calls: 4 microphones with the latest cVc noise reduction technology effectively highlight your voice while reducing background sounds.
Up to 28 Hours of Playtime: Enjoy 7 hours of playtime on a single charge and extend to 28 hours with the charging case. 
Fast-Charging: When you’re running short on time, a 10-minute charge will give you 2 hours of listening. 
Wireless Charging Compatible: Simply place the charging case on a wireless charging pad for convenient charging. 
Water-Resistant Design: Liberty Air 2’s IPX5-rated protection defends your earbuds against rain, sweat, and more. 
Customizable EarTips: Choose from 5 sizes of EarTips to find your perfect fit for enhanced passive noise cancellation and comfort. 

Note: 
If using with an iPhone 11, incoming calls may cause the Bluetooth connection to drop for 2 - 4 seconds before reconnecting.
Upgrade to iPhone 11/iPhone 11 Pro’s latest version of iOS to ensure compatibility with Liberty Air 2. 
Playtime varies according to volume and audio content.
This product cannot be connected with multiple devices at the same time. If you need a pair of earbuds that simultaneously connects with multiple devices, check out Soundbuds Slim and Spirit X (Upgraded).
When enjoying the immersive listening experience, ensure you pay attention to your personal safety. 
Liberty Air 2 are not designed for swimming, showering, or exposure to pool or ocean water. Do not use in a sauna or steam room. The charging case is not waterproof. As a result of daily use, the effectiveness of the earbuds’ waterproofing may reduce over time. 
Before charging the case ensure the port is completely dry and only use a certified USB-C cable. 

Specifications

Model: A3910
Impedance: 16 Ω
Frequency response: 20 Hz - 20 kHz
Bluetooth audio codec: SBC, AAC, aptX
Bluetooth transmitter frequency: 2402-2480 MHz
Bluetooth range: 10m / 32ft

feature_bullets: Diamond-Inspired Sound: Inspired by the ultra-hard structure of diamonds, Liberty Air 2’s driver domes maintain their rigidity even when vibrating at high frequencies. Music is reproduced with a 15% larger frequency bandwidth for clear treble and 2× more bass.

Perfect for Home Offices: Each earbud is equipped with two microphones and cVc 8.0 noise reduction technology. Environmental noises are reduced by 60%, while 95% of your voice is retained so you sound louder and clearer on the other end.

Up to 28 Hours of Playtime*: A single charge gives you a full 7 hours of listening, while the charging case extends it to 28 hours of playtime. And when the case needs a power boost, simply set it down on a wireless charger.

HearID Technology: Take the test to create a custom set of EQ settings that are optimized for your ears. HearID maps your hearing sensitivity at multiple frequencies and intelligently analyzes the results to give you a truly personalized listening experience.
One-Step Pairing and Bluetooth 5.0 Connectivity: Liberty Air 2 wireless earphones use Bluetooth 5.0 for a fast, strong, and ultra-stable connection.
